citeinfo.origin: Northwest Indian Fisheries Commission and Point No Point Treaty Council, Salmon and Steelhead Habitat Inventory and Assessment Program (SSHIAP)
citeinfo.title: Geomorph_PS_S
citeinfo.othercit: Quality Assurance Methodology for Mapping Marine Shoreline Geomorphology, Steve Todd, Osa Odum, Aundrea McBride, and Marilu Koschak. Available upon distribution of data.

descript.abstract: The Salmon and Steelhead Habitat Inventory and Assessment Program (SSHIAP) has mapped the Washington State shoreline according to geomorphology. In 2008 SSHIAP completed a quality assurance (QA) on the initial draft dataset for the Puget Sound region. In 2009, SSHIAP completed a QA version for the outer Washington coast using similar methodologies. The mapping was based on a geomorphic classification model developed by McBride et al. (2005). The model uses existing information to determine dominant processes (i.e., tidal erosion, wave deposition, fluvial deposition), surface geology/shoreline material (e.g. bedrock, cohesive sediments, loose sediments), and topography (i.e., steep, gentle, and flat) to map the shoreline into geomorphic units. The Washington Department of Natural Resources (WDNR) ShoreZone spatial dataset represents the shoreline, and WDNR aquatic boundary spatial dataset and National Wetlands Inventory spatial dataset represent the Extreme Low Water (ELW). In performing the quality assurance phase of the mapping for the Puget Sound region, SSHIAP used supplemental datasets that were not widely available during the initial mapping phase, including a revised drift cell dataset (unpublished from PSNERP 2008), 1:24000 scale geology maps in a few locations, historic and current tidal wetland datasets available through the University of Washington River History Project (UWRHP), and the Washington Department of Ecology oblique air photos from 2006, available via the world wide web at the Washington Digital Coastal Atlas. Data is available as ArcGIS geodatabase format.
descript.purpose: This nearshore classification was developed for addressing specific applications regarding habitat protection, restoration, and land use policies and regulations that affect nearshore processes, including salmonid habitat structure and function.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

place.placekey: Puget Sound, Washington State marine shorelines

cntinfo.cntinst: For details or more information about the geomorphic mapping contact Ron McFarlane at 360-528-4368

procstep.procdesc: Refer to "Quality Assurance Methodology for Mapping Marine Shoreline Geomorphology" available through the Salmon and Steelhead Habitat Inventory and Assessment Program (SSHIAP), Northwest Indian Fisheries Commission.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Automatically generated numerical value from ArcHydro Tools.
Numerical code derived from attribute field "UnitID" from WDNR ShoreZone dataset, attribute field "AQBDRYID" from WDNR Aquatic Boundary dataset, and attribute field "FID" from USFWS NWI dataset.
Text description of name (if any) derived from original data.
Text description categorizing the data into the following: Coastline, ELW, or Breakline.
attr.attrdefs: Coastline from WDNR ShoreZone, ELW from WDNR Aquatic Boundary or USFWS NWI dataset, and Breakline from NWIFC for enclosing polygons.

attr.attrdef: Text description used to classify the surface geology (WDNR 100K) into the following: loose sediments, cohesive sediments, bedrock, and artificial.
Text description of source data for MatrlClass attribute field.
Text description used to categorize the slope into the following slope classes from 10m DEM: flat (0-3 degrees), gentle (3-7 degrees), or steep (>7 degrees).

Text description used to classify the dominant process from WDOE Net-Shore Drift or WDNR Hydrography into the following categories: fluvial deposition, wave deposition, wave erosion, wave transport, tidal erosion, neutral, or modified.
Text description of the source data used for classifying dominant process.
Date value derived from when original source data was created.
Date that GeoUnit went throught the QA/air photo mapping process
Indicates whether freshwater input occurs in association with the GeoUnit
Misc. notes for the GeoUnit pertaining to the QA process
Rationale for revising GeoUnit through QA process
Broad scale geographic area e.g., Puget Sound/Georgia Basin, or Coast
Puget Sound Sub-basin Name as defined by Puget Sound Partnership (e.g., Whidbey)
Text description of GeoUnit feature that occurs outside of WDNR Shorezone line, seaward (e.g. spits) or landward (e.g. lagoons). See Attribute: GeoUnit.
Text description of geomorphic unit (see GeoUnitCode)
